result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew James Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $442.00 - 60 DTP.  5 days in RCJ for contempt if not paid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Status conference on June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew James Patterson in court.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.  With clean ZCI.  State rec: 100+cc.  No objections to expungement.  Atty info given to def.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 23, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m. Defendant has until 4/23/15 to have this done.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Andrew James Patterson in court.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
